Audio Description: Americans are dissuaded from participating in black market activities in this World War II poster. The poster is a drawing of a male shopkeeper on the left and a female customer posing in front of a large black Nazi swastika on a gray background. The smiling shopkeeper is wearing a white shirt, black and white striped tie, white apron, white pants and white shoes. He is writing in a notebook. The smug looking woman has her right hand on her hip and is holding a white purse under her left arm. She is wearing a white beret and a white dress suit with white high heels. The message in large black letters under the graphic reads: “It takes two to make a black market!” In a black bordered box that runs across the bottom of the poster are the words in capital black letters that reads: “Both are violators when they do business without ration stamps…or pay over ceiling prices.”
Creator: United States. Office of Price Administration
